intro: Rhabdosciadium hizanense, commonly known as the Hizan starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is relatively rare and has limited distribution, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
